intro: Sondera marchantii, commonly known as the African liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming moss-like plant that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having structures called rhizoids for anchoring and absorbing moisture. It is often found on bare rock surfaces or in rocky crevices, where it plays a role in soil stabilization. Sondera marchantii is well adapted to survive in harsh conditions, showcasing the resilience of bryophytes in extreme climates.
